result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse James Erickson

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 5, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:44 PM Cases 22CM23 and 22CT02 called together. Defendant Jesse James Erickson in court.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup appeared by video for Jesse James Erickson.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Def waives all in person hearing KIV.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Gramstrup- Def pleading to Count 1 of 22CT2 OWI 2nd w/ recommendations for IDIP guidelines on OWI, and Count 2 of 22CM23- bail jump (misdemeanor) with recommendation of 1 yr probation, withheld sentence.  BAC .192.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  DA interjects- notes def has now been convicted in another county of OWI 2nd- this will actually be an OWI 3rd.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jesse James Erickson
Current: 165A 146th Ave, Turtle Lake, WI 54889 United States  (Effective: 08-05-2022)
Prior: 1278 270Th Ave, Luck, WI 54853 

Jesse called in new address.

9:22 AM Cases 22CM23 and 22CT2 called together.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jesse James Erickson in court.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup appeared by video for Jesse James Erickson. Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: def is working through IDIP, agreement has been reached for pleas to OWI 2nd and misd bond jump with a joint rec of withheld sentence, 1 year probation.  Bond continues.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Status conference on June 9, 2022 at 09:15 am.

09:16 AM Cases 22CM23 and 22CT02 called together.  Defendant, Jesse James Erickson, appeared with Attorney Chris A Gramstrup.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.   Jesse James Erickson appeared in person with Atty Gramstrup by video.  Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: agreement reached Ct 2 in 22CM23 (misd bond jump) and OWI 2nd in 22CT02; DRI remaining counts, def to pursue IDIP; joint rec of 1 yr probation, withheld, AODA, no contact with victim, court costs of $443 on the 22CM23 charge.  Def has not yet contacted IDIP coordinator, needs to do so very soon, pamphlet provided.  Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 09:15 am.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on April 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

01:11 PM Cases 22CM23 and 22CT02 called together.  Defendant, Jesse James Erickson, appeared with Attorney Chris A Gramstrup.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  All parties appear in person.  Case 22CM23 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG pleas entered.  Court addresses attorney fees, def makes statement.  State asks for bond and no contact with the victim.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

$150 cash component of bond (has already been posted).  Absolutely no contact with the victim or the victim's residence.    The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No consumption of alcohol.  Defendant is restricted from any establishments whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol- such as bars, taverns, beer tents, and liquor stores.
Clerk letter to def RE: self-pay atty fees and payment schedule
Certified copy of bail/bond in Polk County case 21CT61
Letter from DA re: Copy of summons and complaint to defendant
Citation filed with cash bond posted
